N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 621.3 - Statutory authority

State Regulations
(a) Section
13.07
of
the Mental Hygiene Law sets forth the authority of OPWDD to pursue the
expansion of services and the development of new methods of service delivery to
serve the full range of needs of persons with developmental
disabilities. (b) 13.09 of the

Mental Hygiene Law sets forth the authority of the commissioner to adopt rules
and regulations necessary and proper to implement any matter under his or her
jurisdiction. (c) Section
41.18
and
41.23
of
the Mental Hygiene Law set forth the authority of OPWDD to provide State aid
funding for the capital costs for community facilities, pursuant to a local
services or unified services plan. (d) Section
75.17
of
the Mental Hygiene Law sets forth the authority of the commissioner to approve
mortgage loans for funds available from HFA. (e) Section
75.25
of
the Mental Hygiene Law sets forth the authority of the commissioner to make, alter, amend and repeal rules and regulations for the supervision, examination, regulation and audit of companies (see glossary under company, section
621.14
of this Part. (f) Subdivision 13-c of section 5 of the

Facilities Development Corporation Act sets forth the authority of the
commissioner to promulgate regulations with respect to financing or refinancing
of community facilities by voluntary agencies with the proceeds of funds
realized from the sale of tax-exempt bonds and notes issued by MCFFA. Notes
